text: • For each multiplication fact, write a fact family.
• What do you notice and wonder about dividing rational numbers?

Answers will vary. Possible answers.

  • Fact 1 and Fact 2 begin with the same multiplication with the factors in different order. This shows the Commutative Property. And, the related fact families for division are the same.
  • For division, you divide the way we always have.
  • The pattern for dividing with signed numbers works just like multiplication.

Multiplication:

  • negative • negative = positive
  • negative • positive = negative
  • positive • negative = negative

Division:

  • negative ÷ negative = positive
  • negative ÷ positive = negative
  • positive ÷ negative = negative
• Will the patterns for dividing work for fractions and decimals? Explain why.

Yes.

Possible explanation.

The new patterns we notice are about the numbers being negative and positive. We divide the same way that we did without the negative and positive signs. So, we should be able to divide fractions and decimals. Then we can use what we learned about the negative and positive relationships.
